Container.Name: NginxProxyManager
Container.Overview:
Nginx Proxy Manager enables you to easily forward to your websites running at home or otherwise, including free SSL, without having to know too much about Nginx or Letsencrypt.
Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size).
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-nginx-proxy-manager/blob/master/README.md
**NOTE**: For this container to be accessible from the internet, make sure ports **80** and **443** on the internet side of your router are properly forwarded to this container. See the documentation for more details.
**NOTE**: After a fresh install, the default username/password to connect to the management interface are: > admin@example.com/changeme.
Container.Description:
Nginx Proxy Manager enables you to easily forward to your websites running at home or otherwise, including free SSL, without having to know too much about Nginx or Letsencrypt.
Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size).
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-nginx-proxy-manager/blob/master/README.md.
**NOTE**: For this container to be accessible from the internet, make sure ports **80** and **443** on the internet side of your router are properly forwarded to this container. See the documentation for more details.
**NOTE**: After a fresh install, the default username/password to connect to the management interface are: > admin@example.com/changeme.
Container.Changes:
###v1.21.1 (2021-09-21) - Fixed issue where configuration of a proxy host could fail to load.
###v1.21.0 (2021-09-11) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.9.9.
###v1.20.0 (2021-08-28) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.9.8.
###v1.19.0 (2021-08-08) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.9.7.
###v1.18.0 (2021-08-03) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.6.9. - Removed random delay that was applied when manually renewing a certificate.
###v1.17.0 (2021-06-25) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.9.4.
###v1.16.1 (2021-05-31) - Fixed issue where Certbot plugins installation would cause Python packages conflicts.
###v1.16.0 (2021-05-21) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.9.3.
###v1.15.0 (2021-05-10) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.9.2. - Use the most recent certbot version. - Updated baseimage to version 2.4.5.
###v1.14.0 (2021-03-22) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.8.1.
###v1.13.1 (2021-03-13) - Fixed issue where saving the default site setting would fail.
###v1.13.0 (2021-02-09) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.8.0. - Updated OpenResty to version 1.19.3.1. - Replaced the depricated GeoIP module by GeoIP2.
###v1.12.0 (2021-01-06) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.7.2. - Added the GeoIP Nginx module.
###v1.11.0 (2020-11-24) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.7.1. - Fixed rotation of nginx log files.
###v1.10.3 (2020-11-06) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.6.2.
###v1.10.2 (2020-10-26) - Fixed generation of certificates that use DNS challenge.
###v1.10.1 (2020-10-26) - Fixed automatic installation of Certbot plugins.
###v1.10.0 (2020-10-25) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.6.1. - Now using baseimage version 2.4.4, based on Alpine 3.12, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded glibc to version 2.31 on Alpine Linux images with glibc integrated. - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Use sqlite as database instead of mariadb. - Added proper support for the `DISABLE_IPV6` environment variable. - Periodically clean Let's Encrypt certificates.
###v1.9.2 (2020-07-10) - Fixed an issue where the container would fail to start if custom Nginx files are mounted by Docker.
###v1.9.1 (2020-07-10) - Improved compatibility by disabling usage of SSE4.2 in OpenResty.
###v1.9.0 (2020-07-09) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.3.1.
###v1.8.1 (2020-05-21) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.4.
###v1.8.0 (2020-04-15) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.3.
###v1.7.4 (2020-04-08) - Fixed issue where generated proxy host config would use incorrect ports.
###v1.7.3 (2020-04-07) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.2.
###v1.7.2 (2020-04-06) - Fixed generation of resolvers.conf when IPv6 is involved.
###v1.7.1 (2020-04-06) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.1.
###v1.7.0 (2020-03-16) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.0. - Now using baseimage v2.4.3, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Make sure the tzdata is installed.
###v1.6.0 (2019-10-10) - Rotate Nginx log files. - Added tool to reset password of a user of the management interface.
###v1.5.3 (2019-09-04) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.14.
###v1.5.2 (2019-08-20) - Use baseimage based on Alpine 3.9. - This fixes TLS1.3 support. - Keep the `fastcgi.conf` and `fastcgi_params` Nginx configuration files.
###v1.5.1 (2019-07-02) - Fixed issue where the wrong SSL protocols/ciphers were used.
###v1.5.0 (2019-05-09) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.13. - Now using baseimage v2.4.2, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes.
###v1.4.2 (2019-04-18) - Fixed issue where using a hostname for the upstream proxy host would not work.
###v1.4.1 (2019-04-10) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.12. - Fixed a directory traversal vulnerability.
###v1.4.0 (2019-03-05) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager version 2.0.11.
###v1.3.1 (2019-02-21) - During startup, make sure there is no migration lock held.
###v1.3.0 (2019-02-21) - Make sure to upgrade the database if required. - Properly notify the supervisor when the database is ready. - Make sure to not use the database directory if it was not initialized successfully. - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.9. - Fixed issue where HTTP/2 option could not be disabled. - Added HSTS settings.
###v1.2.1 (2019-01-26) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.9. - Increased custom SSL certificate file size limit.
###v1.2.0 (2019-01-07) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.8. - Added the ability to enable/disable hosts. - IP ranges are now fetched dynamically.
###v1.1.0 (2019-01-03) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.7. - Added HTTP/2 option for SSL enabled hosts. - Added upstream SSL option for proxy hosts.
###v1.0.1 (2018-12-19) - Fixed an issue where creation of an access list would fail.
###v1.0.0 (2018-12-19) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Disable IPv6
Config.Description: When set to '1', IPv6 support is disabled.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port used to access the web interface of the application.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>. For other network types, port 8181 should be used instead.

Config.Name: HTTP Port
Config.Description: Port used to serve HTTP requests.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Your router should be configured to forward port <i>80</i> to this port. If your router doesn't allow setting the destination/internal IP address, this <b><i>must</i></b> be set to <b>80</b>.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>. For other network types, port 8080 should be used instead.

Config.Name: HTTPs Port
Config.Description: Port used to serve HTTPs requests.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Your router should be configured to forward port <i>443</i> to this port. If your router doesn't allow setting the destination/internal IP address, this <b><i>must</i></b> be set to <b>443</b>.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>. For other network types, port 4443 should be used instead.
